paper_title: In-plane polar domains enhanced energy storage

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: Dielectrics with high energy storage performance via an in-plane polar domains incorporating polar nanoregions mechanism.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: Proposes that the in-plane polar domains with polar nanoregions mechanism causes high energy storage performance.
variables_identified: in-plane polar domains incorporating polar nanoregions mechanism
hypotheses.predicted_direction: In-plane polar domains with polar nanoregions will yield higher energy storage performance
hypotheses.notes: Explicit mechanism-level hypothesis about how microstructural domains influence macroscopic energy storage performance

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: La/Si co-doping BaTiO3 solid-solution thin films with high chemical homogeneity to realize high energy storage performance.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: Implies that La/Si co-doping and achieving high chemical homogeneity cause high energy storage performance
variables_identified: La/Si co-doping BaTiO3 solid-solution thin films
hypotheses.predicted_direction: La/Si co-doping BaTiO3 thin films with high chemical homogeneity will realize higher energy storage performance
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Tests whether La/Si co-doping with high homogeneity improves energy storage in BaTiO3 thin films
hypotheses.notes: Material-design/processing hypothesis linking dopant strategy and microstructure to energy storage performance

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: Phase-field simulations can guide the synthesis of BaTiO3-based dielectrics to achieve high energy storage performance.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: Suggests that simulation-guided design influences material performance outcomes
hypotheses.predicted_direction: Phase-field simulation-guided synthesis will yield higher energy storage performance
hypotheses.notes: Explicitly ties computational design guidance to experimental energy storage outcomes

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: This mechanism holds significant promise for the design of next-generation high-performance dielectric materials for energy storage and other advanced functional materials.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: Posits that the in-plane polar domains/polar nanoregions mechanism can be generalized to design other high-performance dielectrics and functional materials
variables_identified: in-plane polar domains incorporating polar nanoregions mechanism
hypotheses.notes: Forward-looking generalization/transferability claim about applying the mechanism to other materials

processing_notes: Hypotheses are extracted from the abstract. Some items express explicit mechanism- or design-based predictions (A, B, C), while others reflect forward-looking generalization (D). No explicit statistical hypotheses are stated in the abstract; all items are treated as testable, mechanism-related claims or design-transferability propositions.
